Question.Text: A 32-Year-Old Woman from Malawi With 3-week history of headache and blurred vision. She is wasted and has a unilateral abducens nerve palsy. She is afebrile and has no neck stiffness.

Answer: Tuberculous meningitis - The wasted patient presents with subacute headache, blurred vision, and unilateral abducens nerve palsy (cranial nerve VI) without fever or neck stiffness in Malawi. The image shows chronic wasting typical of advanced tuberculosis. TB meningitis characteristically presents with cranial nerve palsies (especially III, VI, VII), altered consciousness, and basilar meningitis, often in HIV-endemic areas with insidious onset over weeks.
